q: Bob, John and Mary are best friends and they applied for a job in HackerEarth in the same department but HackerEarth has only one vacancy. Given that the probability of Bob's selection is 1/3, John's selection is 1/4 and that of Mary is 1/8. What is the probability that only one of them will be selected?

Bob buys 40 beds for Rs. 14,725. Among them, 18 are double-beds and  rest are single-beds. At what price he must  sell the double beds so that if he sells the single beds at 1/2 of this price, he makes a profit of 60% on his outlay?

In a college, there are 1500 students who go to any one of the classes, out of the four different classes viz. dance, music, painting & cooking. The ratio of the number of boys and girls among them is 7:8. 40% of the total girls go to the dance class and 55% of the total girls go to painting class. The total number of students going to music class is 240. 230 students go to cooking class. The ratio of the number of girls and the number of boys who go to paint class is 2:1. 30% of the total number of boys go to music class. 370 students go to dancing class. What effect would it make on the number of girls going to music class if the percentage of boys going to music class is changed from 30% to 35%?

The graph given shows the number of good quality apples produced by a farm in the past 5 years starting leftwards from 2021 till 2017. Each year around 800 apples are produced. Which of the following years has shown the minimum increase in the rate of poor quality apples with respect to the year having the highest production of good quality apples?
Study the above graph and answer the questions. Which of the following cities reached the maximum percentage of men traveling for work with respect to the total people of the respective city?

The graph given shows the number of good quality apples produced by a farm in the past 5 years starting leftwards from 2021 till 2017. Each year around 800 apples are produced. If the number of good quality apples is expected to grow by 10% in the coming year, calculate the ratio of good quality apples produced from 2022 to 2020.

A chef spends money on two parties as indicated in the pie chart and the table respectively. The charts show the percentage of the total budget spent on different dishes for the parties. The money spent on the cake is the same for both parties. The chef spent 15% more in total for the second party. If the ice cream cost Rs 15,000 for the first party, how much did the chef spend for biscuits at the second party?

A chef spends money on two parties as indicated in the pie chart and the table respectively. The charts show the percentage of the total budget spent on different dishes for the parties. The money spent on the cake is the same for both parties. The chef spent 15% more in total for the second party. If the chef spent Rs 45,000 for cake in total, how much percentage of their expenditure in the second event went to pizza?

A chef spends money on two parties as indicated in the pie chart and the table respectively. The charts show the percentage of the total budget spent on different dishes for the parties. The money spent on the cake is the same for both parties. The chef spent 15% more in total for the second party. The chef spent Rs 18,000 on the biscuits at the first party. If the cost ratio for cake and pizza in the first party was 5:7, how much did the chef spend on pizza in the second party?

The given line graph shows the percentage change in the number of milk bottles produced by a certain company with respect to different years. The bottles produced in the year 2016 were 4500. What is the difference in production between 2017 and 2020?

The following bar chart represents the number of people who wear different footwear and the tabular column depicts the ratio of small size wearing people to large size wearing people and percentage of males wearing the footwear

The number of females wearing heels and shoes is how much percentage more or less than the number of female from wearing Slippers & Peep toes?

The following bar chart represents the number of people who wear different footwear and the tabular column depicts the ratio of small size wearing people to large size wearing people and the percentage of males wearing the footwear.

If 40% of the females wearing boots choose small size, then what is the percentage of males who have opted for the large size of boots?

Given graph shows the Aluminium and Manganese content in 4 different ores. The table shows the cost of 1kg of Aluminium and Manganese in three years. If the remaining percentage of the ore is worthless, what was the worth of 1kg of Ore 2 in 2012?

The given line graph shows the percentage change in the number of immigrants to a certain country with respect to the previous year. The table shows the population census data from the country over the years. Assume that the change in data is purely due to immigration and emigration. In 2015, if the country accounted for deaths among its inhabitants and this amount was half the percentage of the immigrants that entered the country that year, what would be the new census data for 2015.

The given line graph shows the percentage change in the number of immigrants to a certain country with respect to the previous year. The table shows the population census data from the country over the years. Assume that the change in data is purely due to immigration and emigration. If 2018 saw a population change of 2%, how many immigrants would the country have welcomed?

There are 5 persons Alice, Bob, Mike, Tara, and Lisa who are sitting on a bench. Alice and Bob are next to each other, and Mike and Tara are next to each other. Lisa is sitting on the left end of the bench and she is not sitting with Bob. Mike is sitting in the second position from the right. In which position Alice is sitting?

There are 7 people Ben, Tara, Alice, Mike, Paul, John, and Lisa in a theatre watching a movie facing North. Alice is sitting adjacent to both Mike and Paul. Tara is sitting at one end of the row. John is to the immediate right of Paul and the fourth person to the right of Ben. Alice has only two people sitting right to her. What is the position of Lisa with respect to Alice?

a.option: Alice is 1 position left of Alice
Lisa is 4 positions right of Alice
Alice is 2 positions left of Alice
Lisa is 3 positions left of Alice

q: A, B, C, D, E, and F are sitting in a row. A and F are sitting in the center. C and E are at the ends. D is sitting to the left E, then who is to the right of C?

A,B,C,D,E,F,G, and H are sitting in a round circle. A is sitting at a position second to the right of E who is the neighbor C and G. There are 2 people in between A and G and 3 people in between A and F. If A and D are not neighbors and H is between B and D then which of the following are not neighbors?

A,B,C,D,E,F,G, and H are sitting in a round circle. A is sitting at a position second to the right of E who is the neighbor C and G. There are 2 people in between A and G and 3 people in between A and F. If A and D are not neighbors and H is between B and D. Who are adjacent to A?

A,B,C,D,E,F,G, and H are sitting in a round circle. A is sitting at a position second to the right of E who is the neighbor C and G. There are 2 people in between A and G and 3 people in between A and F. If A and D are not neighbors and H is between B and D then who is to the right of F?

A,B,C,D,E,F,G, and H are sitting in a round circle. A is sitting at a position second to the right of E who is the neighbor C and G. There are 2 people in between A and G and 3 people in between A and F. If A and D are not neighbors and H is between B and D then who is to the left of B?

There are 7 people Ben, Tara, Alice, Mike, Paul, John, and Lisa in a theatre watching a movie facing North. Alice is sitting adjacent to both Mike and Paul. Tara is sitting at one end of the row. John is to the immediate right of Paul and the fourth person to the right of Ben. Alice has only two people sitting right to her. Then who is sitting at the end of the row?

There are 7 members in a family Alice, Mike, Ben, Lisa, Paul, Mary, and Bob, seated at a round table. Lisa and Paul are neighbors and Lisa sitting second to the right Alice. mary and Ben are not neighbors, which of the following can not be neighbors?

There are 7 members in a family Alice, Mike, Ben, Lisa, Paul, Mary, and Bob, seated at a round table. Mike is third to the left of Alice who is sitting second to the left of Lisa. Ben is sitting in between Lisa and Mike. Alice and Bob are not neighbors and Alice is sitting between Mary and Paul. Then which of the following are not neighbors?

There are 5 students Tara, Ben, Paul, Mike, and Alice sitting in a row. Mike is sitting next to Alice, who is sitting next to Paul. Ben is not sitting next to Paul. Also, Mike is sitting on the right end of the row. Who is sitting in between Tara and Alice?

There are 7 students in a classroom Alice, Mike, Ben, Lisa, Paul, Mary, and Bob seated in one row. Mike is between Alice and Lisa but not adjacent to both of them and Alice is on the left side of Mike. Mary is on the left of Alice and Paul on the right of Ben. Lisa is between Ben and Paul and Ben is on the left side of Lisa. Who is at the fifth and sixth position from the right end of the row?

There are 5 students Tara, Ben, Paul, Mike, and Alice sitting in a row. Mike is sitting next to Alice, who is sitting next to Paul. Ben is not sitting next to Paul. Also, Mike is sitting on the right end of the row. Who is sitting next to Tara on the left side?

There are 7 students in a classroom Alice, Mike, Ben, Lisa, Paul, Mary, and Bob seated in one row. Mike is between Alice and Lisa but not adjacent to both of them and Alice is on the left side of Mike. Mary is on the left of Alice and Paul on the right of Ben. Lisa is between Ben and Paul and Ben is on the left side of Lisa, then who is to the immediate left of Mike?

Alice's home from wonderland is 10 km in south direction. Now Bunny met her outside wonderland and dishonestly took her 7.5 km in west direction then turned right and traveled 2kms towards dangerous land. Alice is lost and on finding her way back home she traveled 7.5kms in east and turned right and traveled 5.5kms. How far is she from her house?
The size of a rectangular playground is 8*6 units. A child runs along all four sides of the ground and finally along a diagonal order to catch a ball. How much total distance is covered by the child?

Mike started walking 50km towards north and then turned left. After walking 160km in that direction he turns right and walked 10km. And then he turned back right and moved 80km straight. How far is he from starting point and in which direction?
Alice, Mike, Bob, and Ben decided to play a game of Ludo, but Alice, Ben, and Mike, Bob teamed up as partners. Ben is to the left of Mike who is facing east. Then in which direction is Alice facing?

A board showing directions at a crossing in four-way road got rotated due to heavy storm and wind. Now it is directing in the wrong direction. East is pointer is pointing North. Bob went wanted to go west but walked in the wrong direction due to the rotated board. In which direction was he actually walking?

One fine evening, Alice and Bob decided to play in a park and were standing leaning on each other with their back towards each other. If Alice's shadow fell towards her left-hand side, then in which direction was bob facing?

You started walking 3km towards east and then turned right. After walking a distance of 4km in the same direction. Then you moved 5km in northwest direction and finally stop. In which direction are you from the starting point?

Your direction showing compass has lost its magnetism and is now showing wrong directions. If it is showing north-east instead of south and south-east instead of east and so on. Then what will be the direction of west in the wrong compass?

Block A is to the northeast of block B, block C is to the west of block A and northeast of block B and block D is to the south of block C which is in line with block A and block B. In which direction of block B is block D located?

Students are sitting in three rows all facing towards projector (north). If Q is in the middle row and W is just right of Q but in the same row. E is behind Q while R is in front of W. In which direction of R is E?

Once in a pleasant morning, a girl started her morning walk towards the sun. Then after covering some distance she decided to turn left and then again after covering some distance she turned left. In which direction is she now moving?

Mike walks 4 km towards south. Then he turns towards west and walks 10 km. After this he turns towards north and walks 1 km. Again he turns towards east and walks 6 km. How far is he from the starting point?
Alice, Ben, and Bob are standing at a certain distance from each other. Alice is 160 meters southwest of Ben. If Bob is 160 meters southeast of Ben, then Alice is in which direction of Bob?
If Alice is standing west of Ben who is in the south of Bob. If Mike is in the north of Bob, then what is the direction of Alice with respect to Mike?

Question

Statements

  2. John's sister completed her 10th in the year 1994.

a.option: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient

In a computer lab, John, Bob, Ben, Lisa, and Mark are sitting in a row. If Ben is sitting in between Mark and Bob, Mark is in front in the row, John is sitting beside Lisa and Bob is not sitting beside Lisa. Then in which position Lisa is sitting on that bench?

a.option: At the end of the row

a.option: At the center of the row
At the end of the row

John is standing to the east of his friend Mark and he is present to the north of Lisa. Also, Anita is towards south of Ben, then what is the direction of Anita in John's perspective?

John walks 10 KMS towards east and stops. Then he continues towards south for 5 KMS and takes another 5 KMS west. Now, John takes another 5 KMS towards north and stops. Then to which direction is the starting point in perspective with John's current position?

Mark's Office is 25KMS from his home. If he travels 5 KMS towards west and then travels 10KMS South. Then he takes 10 KMS to the east and stops at the junction. From the junction, if he takes 3 KMS south and 2 KMS east, he arrives at his office. Then which direction is Mark's home with respect to his office?

Lisa traveled 30KMS. She started from home and traveled 5KMS in the east direction. Then she traveled 8 KMS south to visit Ben. From there she traveled again in east for 4KMS and went in the south direction for 1KMS for a bookstore. Then she took the next turn and traveled east for 3KMS and traveled again north for 9 KMS to reach her office. Then in which direction is her home from her office's perspective?

Bob on his way to school takes the first street and travels 9KMS east, then travels south for another 5KMS and takes the last exit and travels again 5KMS north. Then in which direction is Bob's school from his house's perspective?

John on his way to the office has to drop a parcel off at the post office. So first he went towards the post office by traveling 5KMS south and 4 KMS east to reach the post office. Then he traveled 5KMS north and took 7KMS east. Then to reach the entrance he took the next exit in south 1KMS and traveled 2KMS east and finally traveled 1KMS north to reach his destination. Then from the post office, his destination is in which direction?

Situation: When Alice, tops in her MBBS course, she becomes the 7th member of her family to join the Medical profession. All other family members namely John, Tara, Bob, Ben, Lisa, and Anita are working at a hospital as doctors and Alice who is the youngest of the third generation is all set to join them. In this family of three generations, there are two pairs of couples and two pairs of brothers and sisters. There are three Oncologists, two Dentists, one Physician, and one Neurologist in the family. No female in the family is an Oncologist. Anita is not a Neurologist. No married person in the family is a Dentist. John is the son of Tara while Ben is the son of Bob and Bob's wife is Anita. Bob is an Oncologist. Bob and Anita are the eldest couples in the family. Alice is the daughter of Ben while Lisa is the sister-in-law of Tara.

Situation: When Alice tops in her MBBS course, she becomes the 7th member of her family to join the Medical profession. All other family members namely John, Tara, Bob, Ben, Lisa, and Anita are working at a hospital as doctors and Alice who is the youngest of the third generation is all set to join them. In this family of three generations, there are two pairs of couples and two pairs of brothers and sisters. There are three Oncologists, two Dentists, one Physician, and one Neurologist in the family. No female in the family is an Oncologist. Anita is not a Neurologist. No married person in the family is a Dentist. John is the son of Tara while Ben is the son of Bob and Bob's wife is Anita. Bob is an Oncologist. Bob and Anita are the eldest couples in the family. Alice is the daughter of Ben while Lisa is the sister-in-law of Tara.

Problem: Who among the following is a Physician?

Situation: When Alice tops in her MBBS course, she becomes the 7th member of her family to join the Medical profession. All other family members namely John, Tara, Bob, Ben, Lisa, and Anita are working at a hospital as doctors and Alice who is the youngest of the third generation is all set to join them. In this family of three generations, there are two pairs of couples and two pairs of brothers and sisters. There are three Oncologists, two Dentists, one Physician, and one Neurologist in the family. No female in the family is an Oncologist. Anita is not a Neurologist. No married person in the family is a Dentist. John is the son of Tara while Ben is the son of Bob and Bob's wife is Anita. Bob is an Oncologist. Bob and Anita are the eldest couples in the family. Alice is the daughter of Ben while Lisa is the sister-in-law of Tara.

Problem: Who among the following persons is not an oncologist?

Situation: When Alice, tops in her MBBS course, she becomes the 7th member of her family to join the Medical profession. All other family members namely John, Tara, Bob, Ben, Lisa, and Anita are working at a hospital as doctors and Alice who is the youngest of the third generation is all set to join them. In this family of three generations, there are two pairs of couples and two pairs of brothers and sisters. There are three Oncologists, two Dentists, one Physician, and one Neurologist in the family. No female in the family is an Oncologist. Anita is not a Neurologist. No married person in the family is a Dentist. John is the son of Tara while Ben is the son of Bob and Bob's wife is Anita. Bob is an Oncologist. Bob and Anita are the eldest couples in the family. Alice is the daughter of Ben while Lisa is the sister-in-law of Tara.

There are five managers A, B, C, D, E in a company. Consider the statements given alongside the managers.

Determine the incorrect deductions made from the given statements.

  1. The company is open five days a week.
  2. In a day only two managers can be present in the company.
  3. No manager can come to the company on consecutive days.
  4. Also, no same pair of managers can come twice a week.
  5. A and C go to the company on the 3rd day.
  6. B and E go on the 4th day.
  7. C and B go to the company on the 1st and 2nd day, respectively.

a.option: C works on1st and 3rd day of the week.
D and A work on 5th day of the week.
B and C works on first days of week.
D works on 2nd and 5th day of the week

"It seems like you are rearranging chairs on the titanic".

That your task is not being done as quickly as expected
That the task you are doing is irrelevant
That the task you are doing is very important

Consider the following information:

Six colleagues of an office namely, M, Q, O, R, N, and S are playing cricket.
1. M and Y are brothers and S is the sister of N.
2. O is the only son of M's uncle.
3. Q and R are the daughters of the brother of O's father.
4. M and Q are not siblings.

Now, how many of these colleagues are real brothers?

How is F related to J?
